title: WCAS SOCIOL 476-0-23 Topics in Sociological Analysis

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: In this seminar we will consider how one formulates a research questions and puts evidence together in order to investigate specific instances of the culture-society interaction and, from doing so, to assess cultural theory. The course is for students who (1) have a background in cultural sociology (usually by having taken SOC 420), and (2) have a research project involving culture, one that is either already underway or in the planning stages. All participants must be actively engaged in a piece of cultural research (dissertation proposal, second-year paper, etc.), at least for the duration of the course itself. The goal is to create a productive interplay between research activities and methodological awareness.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
This course is on Department Consent. You must receive a permission number to enroll

Open to students who have taken SOC 420 or equivalant; permission of instructor needed before registering.
